intro: Psychotria petiolaris, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine conditions. Due to its unique adaptations, it plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
